ratings.comment: this so called proffesor is very proud and cant see past his mistakes. when grading assignements he is very unfair. does not know how to teach and is very condescending during class. avoid him with all costs.

This guy is very unfair. When the assignment is graded he will add requestment that was not even there and the grade suffers. Do not take this guy if you want to have a good accounting class experience.

Dr. Barr-Pulliam is fair but tough. You will have a B if you attend every class and participate and grasp most of the concepts. However, it is very difficult to achieve higher than an A. (To receive an A you will need all 3 tests to be 90% or higher). He writes his own test questions and those were tough.

Professor Barr-Pulliam is an expert in his field, but he was one of the worst accounting professors I had at UW. He is condescending during lectures which deters many students from asking questions. His grading is inconsistent compared to prior Professors who taught this course. I encourage others to take this course with a different professor.

Dr. Barr-Pulliam is fair but tough. This class is an easy B if you attend every class and participate and grasp most of the concepts. However, it is very difficult to achieve higher than a B. You need to do extra practice problems and read the textbook thoroughly to really succeed.

Prof. Barr-Pulliam is a really good guy who seems to really want his students to learn a lot.  However, he often assigns last minute homework problems in addition to the daily Wiley problems which take up a lot of time.  He isn't the best at answering questions and tests often didn't test what seemed to be stressed in class.  Good guy, hard class

301 is like 100 but more specific and difficult. Barr makes all the exams so you better go to the lectures. He won't post the comprehensive slides, so make sure to download the slides beforehand and add notes to it. Exams are hard. Lots of work. Good luck.

Not horrible, but if given the option take with someone else. Lectures consist of him reading off the detail-lacking slides. When asked questions he either gave confusing answers that did not answer the question or else did not know the answer. Overall class was not taught well, was not very prompt with deadlines, and always canceled office hours.

Professor Barr-Pulliam is a nice guy and tries to engage with students. However his lectures are too brief and lack details/examples. They also move quickly and its hard to take notes. Tests are very fair and not usually a time crunch.
